item.title: 通胀降温，莫桑比克延续降息纪录
item.description: 莫桑比克中央银行创纪录地连续第九次下调基准利率，通货膨胀率将保持在个位数。【原文：Mozambique’s central bank lowered its benchmark interest rate for a record 9th consecutive time, with inflation set to remain in the single digits.】

item.title: 迫在眉睫的英国央行决定为英国预算蒙上 40 亿英镑的阴影
item.description: 英格兰银行必须在未来几个月内做出的一项决定对英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）的支出计划构成了 43 亿英镑（58 亿美元）的威胁。【原文：A decision that the Bank of England has to make in the next few months is posing a £4.3 billion ($5.8 billion) threat to Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ spending plans.】

item.title: 密歇根州五月份最终调查显示美国消费者信心有所恢复
item.description: 5 月下旬，美国消费者信心指数从月初的历史最低值之一反弹，长期通胀预期也有所回落，因为在中国关税退坡后，市场对经济的担忧有所缓解。【原文：US consumer sentiment rebounded in late May from one of the lowest readings on record earlier in the month and long-term inflation expectations retreated as concerns about the economy eased after the rollback of China tariffs.】

item.title: 阿克曼、德鲁肯米勒追踪 ETF 是最新的行业赌局
item.description: 在拥挤的 ETF 市场上，吸引眼球的广告铺天盖地，但有一个想法却屡试不爽：追踪明星投资者的交易，并向大众销售。【原文：In a crowded ETF market obsessed with attention-grabbing pitches, one idea keeps coming back: Track the trades of star investors and sell them to the masses.】

item.title: Zara's Ortega 斥资 2.5 亿欧元购买巴塞罗那 Blackstone 大厦
item.description: 西班牙亿万富翁阿曼西奥-奥尔特加（Amancio Ortega）以约 2.5 亿欧元（2.84 亿美元）的价格从黑石集团（Blackstone Inc.【原文：Spanish billionaire Amancio Ortega has acquired a building on Barcelona’s iconic Diagonal avenue for about €250 million ($284 million) from Blackstone Inc.】

item.title: 报复特朗普征税后加拿大关税收入大幅增长
item.description: 海关进口关税的飙升表明，报复性关税的收益开始进入加拿大联邦政府的国库。【原文：A spike in custom import duties shows proceeds from retaliatory tariffs are starting to roll into the coffers of Canada’s federal government.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数下跌，贸易紧张局势再起令市场情绪受挫
item.description: 美国股市周五下跌，因为唐纳德-特朗普总统指责中国违反了与美国达成的放宽关税的协议，白宫与中国政府之间的紧张关系再度升级。【原文：US stocks fell on Friday as President Donald Trump accused China of violating an agreement with the US to ease tariffs, renewing tensions between the White House and Beijing.】

item.title: Dolce & Gabbana 获得新现金以资助对美容产品的投资
item.description: 杜嘉班纳公司（Dolce & Gabbana Srl）从债权人处获得了额外债务，以资助其在美容和房地产领域的扩张。【原文：Dolce & Gabbana Srl has obtained additional debt from its creditors to fund its expansion in the beauty and property sectors.】

item.title: 德国大风天气再次将电价拖至零点以下
item.description: 德国再次出现大风天气，推动了电价下跌，而市场上的太阳能发电已经开始蓬勃发展。【原文：Windy weather has returned to Germany, pushing down electricity prices in a market already contending with a boom in solar power.】

item.title: EchoStar 因 FCC 调查的不确定性而放弃债券利息
item.description: 亿万富翁查理-厄根（Charlie Ergen）控制的无线和付费电视运营商 EchoStar 公司，因监管调查的不确定性而未支付周五到期的利息。【原文：EchoStar Corp., the wireless and pay-TV operator controlled by billionaire Charlie Ergen, skipped an interest payment due Friday because of uncertainty about a regulatory probe.】

item.title: 欧佩克（OPEC）再次增加供应迫在眉睫，能源投资者人心惶惶
item.description: 石油和天然气股票的投资者正怀着恐惧的心情对待本周末的欧佩克+会议，他们预计在价格已经很低的情况下，将再次出现超大规模的供应增长。【原文：Investors in oil and gas stocks are approaching this weekend’s OPEC+ meeting with a sense of dread, expecting another super-sized supply boost at a time when prices are already low.】

item.title: 斯坦霍夫欺诈案审判移至南非高等法院
item.description: 南非将把该国历史上最大的企业欺诈案的高管案件移交给更高级别的法院进行复杂的刑事审判，他们的下一次听证会也将推迟到 9 月份。【原文：South Africa’s case against executives in the biggest corporate fraud in the country’s history will be moved to a higher court for complex criminal trials, with their next hearing also pushed back to September.】

item.title: 波音公司五月大举扩张后，空中客车公司寻求在中东卷土重来
item.description: 在老对手波音公司（Boeing Co. ）本月达成有史以来最大的一笔交易后，欧洲飞机制造商空手而归，而空中客车公司（Airbus SE）正寻求在六月份以大量新订单卷土重来。【原文：Airbus SE is looking to stage a comeback in June with a flurry of fresh orders after arch-rival Boeing Co. logged its biggest-ever deal this month that left the European planemaker empty-handed.】

item.title: 据说欧佩克+将考虑在 7 月份增产超过 41.1 万桶/日
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，欧佩克+正考虑进一步加快增产，在周六的会议上讨论7月份日产量可能增加41.1万桶以上，以挽回失去的市场份额。【原文：OPEC+ is considering accelerating production increases further by discussing a potential hike of more than 411,000 barrels a day in July at a meeting on Saturday as the group seeks to recoup lost market share, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 在中国的推动下，南非股市再创新高
item.description: 在中国最有价值公司的帮助下，南非基准股价指数将创下近一年来最好的一个月。【原文：South Africa’s benchmark stock index is heading for its best month in almost a year, with a helping hand from China’s most valuable company.】

item.title: 美国消费者支出增长放缓，通胀依然疲软
item.description: 美国消费者在 4 月份的支出创下 2023 年初以来最强劲的一个月后踩下了刹车，而通胀依然温和，这与经济放缓的趋势一致。【原文：US consumers hit the brakes in April after the strongest month of spending since early 2023 while inflation remained tame, consistent with a slowing economy.】

item.title: 加拿大第一季度国内生产总值增长 2.2%，超过所有预测值
item.description: 今年年初，由关税驱动的出口大幅增长推动了加拿大的经济增长，抵消了国内其他经济部门的疲软。【原文：A strong jump in tariff-driven exports fueled Canada’s growth at the start of this year, offsetting domestic weakness in other parts of the economy.】

item.title: 欧洲央行加强审查银行对私人市场的风险敞口
item.description: 由于担心相关资产类别的快速上升会带来新的巨大风险，欧洲中央银行正在加强对贷款人在私人市场风险敞口的审查。【原文：The European Central Bank is escalating its scrutiny of lenders’ exposures to private markets amid concerns that the fast ascent of related asset classes raises substantial new risks.】

item.title: 特朗普称中国 "完全违反 "与美国的贸易协定
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普指责中国违反了与美国达成的放宽关税的协议，加剧了世界两大经济体之间的紧张关系。【原文：US President Donald Trump accused China of violating an agreement with the US to ease tariffs, ratcheting up tensions between the world’s two largest economies.】

item.title: 德国通胀放缓幅度低于预期，欧洲央行将减息
item.description: 德国通胀放缓幅度低于预期，凸显了欧洲央行准备再次降息之际挥之不去的风险。【原文：German inflation slowed less than expected, highlighting lingering risks as the European Central Bank prepares to lower interest rates again.】

item.title: 高利率未能抑制巴西经济增长，巴西经济再创辉煌
item.description: 在丰收和家庭消费的推动下，巴西经济在 2025 年初蓬勃发展，这使得政策制定者与高于目标的通胀率作斗争变得更加复杂。【原文：Brazil’s economy boomed at the start of 2025, powered by bountiful harvests and family consumption that’s complicating policymakers’ fight against above-target inflation.】

item.title: 苹果对中国的依赖远不止于劳动力成本
item.description:
一本新书认为，该公司的外包方式是一种难以消除的强大竞争优势。【原文：

A new book argues that the company’s approach to outsourcing is a formidable competitive advantage that would be difficult to unravel. 

】

item.title: 美股轻松下注的终结对逆向交易者有利
item.description:
经济的不确定性和美元的疲软使更多资金流向长期以来被忽视的多元化投资。【原文：

A climate of economic uncertainty and a weakening dollar have more money flowing to long-ignored diversification bets.

】

item.title: 美国炼油企业驾车季强势启动
item.description:
至少目前看来，便宜汽油的诱惑力似乎超过了消费者对经济的担忧。【原文：

At least for now, the allure of cheaper gasoline appears to be outweighing concerns consumers may have about the economy.

】

item.title: 劳合社保险公司比斯利获得新公牛，巩固独特地位
item.description: 富时 100 指数中唯一一只所有分析师都推荐买入的股票，又多了一只牛股。【原文：The only stock in the FTSE 100 with buy recommendations from every analyst that covers it just gained another bull.】

item.title: 美国国债因赤字问题将出现 2025 年来首次月度亏损
item.description: 受关税不确定性重燃以及对政府债务水平不断攀升的忧虑加剧的影响，美国国债有望出现今年以来的首次月度亏损。【原文：US Treasuries are on track to deliver their first monthly loss this year, buffeted by renewed tariff uncertainty and growing anxiety over mounting levels of government debt.】

item.title: 关税裁决威胁到特朗普计划中 2 Trillion 美元的财政缺口
item.description: 法院的裁决阻止了唐纳德-特朗普总统的大部分全面关税措施，如果裁决继续有效，一些经济学家估计美国未来十年的财政前景可能会出现 2 万亿美元的缺口。【原文：The court ruling that blocked much of President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs threatens to blow what some economists estimate as a $2 trillion hole into the US fiscal outlook over the coming decade, should the judgment stay in place.】

item.title: 特朗普关税让美国餐馆重新考虑荷兰高达奶酪
item.description: 几十年来，由于全球化和自由贸易的发展，美国餐馆在很大程度上认为进口食品可以以合理的价格买到。【原文：For decades, American restaurants have largely taken for granted that imported foods would be readily available at reasonable prices, thanks to decades of globalization and free trade.】

item.title: 南非的 Kganyago 为新兴市场最佳债券回报率提供燃料
item.description: 南非央行行长为该国的本币债券提供了另一个增加其市场领先回报的理由。【原文：South Africa’s central bank chief has given the country’s local-currency bonds another reason to add to their market-leading returns.】

item.title: 新世界发展推迟支付永久债券票息
item.description: 新世界发展有限公司（New World Development Co., Ltd.）表示，该公司计划推迟支付 6 月份到期的永续债券票息，因为该现金拮据的建筑商通知持有人其决定的最后期限已经临近。【原文：New World Development Co. said that it plans to defer coupon payments due in June on perpetual bonds, as a deadline neared for the cash-strapped builder to notify holders of its decision.】
